result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J. Writz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud on Taxicab Operator (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.21(1m)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:41 am
INCLUDES 16CF753, 16CF536, 16CF473, 15CM2281, 15CF825, 15CF988, and 16TR3016. 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher for Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Julie Sawyer. 
State notes parties do NOT have an agreement in 16TR3016. 
COURT sets calendar call in 16TR3016 for 9/28/2016 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF753, 16CF536, AND 16CF473. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 16CF536: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater Enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer)>>DELETE Repeater Enhancer. 
In 16CF473: Ct. 2 (Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Theft)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 16CF753: Ct. 1 (Escape - Criminal Arrest)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF536: Amended Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Amended Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF473: Ct. 1 (Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING AND SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 16CF753, 16CF536, 16CF473, 15CM2281, 15CF825 AND 15CF988. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CF753: Ct. 1>>4 years imprisonment - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - with 42 days credit. 
In 16CF536: Ct. 1>>4 years imprisonment - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - with NO days credit. 
                    : Ct. 2>>9 months MCJ with NO days jail credit. 
In 16CF473: Ct. 1>>4 years imprisonment - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - with NO days credit - CONDITION: letter of apology to G.S.
In 15CM2281: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ with 195 days jail credit. 
In 15CF825: Ct. 2>>6 months MCJ with 195 days jail credit. 
In 15CF988: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ with 195 days jail credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge for each count convicted; CC. 

COURT ORDERS all sentences imposed today are to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP on all prison counts. 
COURT enters judment on unpaid costs in 15CM2281, 15CF825, and 15CF988. 
COURT remands def into custody of MCSD for transport to WSPS. 

Adj: 11:09 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

No contact with All American Taxi, Downtown Pawn, Wausau Gun & Loan, M.Z, Kwik Trip, Pawn America and Pick n Save. Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
